options.a: Supervised uses labeled data, unsupervised uses unlabeled data
options.d: There is no difference

question: What is the purpose of the GROUP BY clause in SQL?

options.a: To filter rows
options.c: To group rows that have the same values

question: What is the difference between a parameter and a statistic?

options.a: A parameter describes a sample, a statistic describes a population
options.b: A parameter describes a population, a statistic describes a sample
options.d: A parameter is always larger than a statistic

question: What is the purpose of the HAVING clause in SQL?

options.a: To filter groups after aggregation
options.d: To join tables

question: What is the difference between inner join and outer join?

options.a: Inner join returns only matching rows, outer join returns all rows from at least one table
options.b: Inner join is faster than outer join
options.c: Outer join is used only for text data
options.d: There is no difference

options.a: To group rows
options.b: To filter rows before any groupings are made
options.d: To join tables

options.a: To predict the value of a dependent variable based on independent variables
